title: Cryptuiwiz to support timestamp-reply
body:
Please add support for Cryptuiwiz API to handle timestamp-reply
It currently only supports octet-stream. In trying to use SHA2 Timestamp(current Microsoft guidelines) servers, the powershell cmdlet set-authenticodesignature fails to apply the timestamp. This cmdlet uses the cryptuiwiz api.

comments.body:
Same here: I would like to replace SignTool by PowerShell Set-AuthenticodeSignature
But I cannot because using -TimestampServer http://sha256timestamp.ws.symantec.com/sha256/timestamp gives error:
Status : UnknownError
StatusMessage : ASN1 bad tag value met
